intro: Acrotriche dura, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in desert environments. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves that help conserve water. Its showy, bell-shaped flowers are typically white or pale purple, blooming in the early morning. Acrotriche dura has adapted to extreme heat and drought, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
